Bohemia Interactive's debut game published by Codemasters as Operation Flashpoint in 2001, became genre-defining combat military simulation and the No. 1 bestselling PC game around the world and has won many international awards, including “Game of The Year” and “Best Action Game”. Over 2 million copies have been sold since its release.

About This Game

Bohemia Interactive's debut game published by Codemasters as Operation Flashpoint in 2001, became genre-defining combat military simulation and the No. 1 bestselling PC game around the world and has won many international awards, including “Game of The Year” and “Best Action Game”. Over 2 million copies have been sold since its release.

Storyline

The horrors of WWIII are imminent.
There are clashes over the Malden Islands from dusk to dawn and you are caught in-between. You must use all of the available resources in your arsenal to hold back the incoming darkness. Victor Troska came back to Nogovo, he thought the pain of war was left buried in his past.
But his dream lies broken now.

His worst nightmare returns when military forces lands near Nogovo.

Key Features

Cold War Assault
  • Command squad of fully equipped troops
  • Over 40 authentic vehicles and aircraft
  • Immersive campaign and single missions
  • LAN/Internet multiplay
  • Vast 100km2 battlezones
Resistance
  • Story-driven 20-mission campaign
  • Nogova – the new 100km2 island
  • New vehicles, weapons and equipment
  • Detailed urban environments
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum
    • OS: Windows XP or Windows Vista or Windows 7
    • Processor: Intel Pentium II 500 MHz or AMD Athlon 600 MHz
    • Memory: 128MB RAM
    • Graphics: DirectX 8.1 compatible 3D graphics card with 16MB RAM
    • DirectX®: DirectX 8.1
    • Hard Drive: 800MB free space
    • Sound: OpenAL sound compatible audiocard (DirectX via compatibility switch)
    Recommended
    • OS: Windows XP or Windows Vista or Windows 7
    • Processor: Intel Dual-core 2.4GHz or AMD Dual-core Athlon 2.5GHz
    • Memory: 1GB RAM
    • Graphics: Nvidia Geforce 8600GT or ATI Radeon 3650 or faster with 256MB VRAM
    • DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: Hard Drive: 1 GB free space
    • Sound: OpenAL sound compatible audiocard (DirectX via compatibility switch)

[BLOB]WinterWolf
140 products in account
3 reviews
Recommended
3.1 hrs on record
Posted: May 28
"I have played this for hours and hours when it was released in 2001, called Operation Flashpoint: Cold War Crisis, almost 2 years before Steam was released"

An old classic military simulator, actually the first one.
Have had many hours in this game, building Zombie missions, getting chased by robots and just pure and fun deathmatch with friends!

If you want an improvemwnt to this awesome game try the FFUR 1985 2008 Mod, which keeps some things from the original ARMA: http://operationflashpoint.filefront.com/file/FFUR_1985_2008_Edition;92092
Or the FFUR SLX 2007 mod, which improves everything: http://operationflashpoint.filefront.com/file/FFURSLX_2007;82613
It'll improve the AI and also the graphics/gameplay!

There's also plenty of addons and mods out there that you can mess around with in the built in mission editor.

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
12 of 13 people (92%) found this review helpful
1

1 person found this review funny
Katrina the Insane
90 products in account
7 reviews
Recommended
11.0 hrs on record
Posted: July 28
This game made a very big part of my war loving childhood, and a love for tactical gameplay with a lot of realism, this is a godsent for all the people that want a challenge and a bit of fun with the game's setting of the good ol' 2001, yet it doesn't even take away from the realism one bit. The only downside is that its missing a working multiplayer (it has MP support, but there aren't any active servers sadly), which would really make the game a lot more cooler just like the other games in the Arma series.

And yes, the graphics aren't as good as they are today, but it does give a bit of a nostalgic feeling to it, I mean, just look at those face textures, put a bullet in them, now look at them again! And yes, there are a few bugs and glitches which aren't exactly sorted out, but it doesn't matter, nor does it take away from the game, yes, even the flying bodies after explosions don't take it away, despite how funny it looks to see a body flying across the landscape.

Storyline is, meh, not really a stretch, but there are some moments the game will really give you with it. I will even mention, the outdated dialogue alongside the radio transmissions are always fun to hear, really, it is, just listen to Kowalski arguing!

The game also comes with the amazing mission editor, just like in the rest of the Arma games, make your own missions and such, it's pretty fun when boredom is not an option, while it doesn't give as much as the other Arma games do, it suffices enough to keep you screwing around with for more.

Is it worth buying? YES. Especially since it's only 4€, it's a perfect price worth taking, especially since its rather old, but nevertheless, gold. While of course I still wish it had a few servers around that I could play in with some other people, and perhaps a bit of workshop avilability (this game CAN be modded, though its really hard to find any good mods around the internet lately, either that, or I'm just bad at searching) to make the game more fun to play with, in any case, this is still one of my games that made my war loving childhood, and I wish for it to get into the hearts of many people of today, to give them the taste of what amazing masterpieces games like these were back in the days.

Oh, and remember to use cover and prone a lot, those AI might have a dumb coding which makes them go into crawl mode from simply hearing a single gunshot, and run-stop-run around, but they aren't exactly forgiving if they see you running around an open area in the distance, not to mention aimbot you at mid ranges if you aren't smart enough to duck behind cover in time, just a friendly advice, is all.
